bullets.text: Fed and FDIC released public sections of large-bank resolution plans, signaling continued focus on resolvability, liquidity, and living wills for systemic institutions.
U.S. ratchets up sanctions on Russia’s oil sector, targeting ship-to-ship transfers, insurers, and refiners to squeeze revenues and enforce price caps; Europe coordinating new pressure.
Washington mulls software-linked export controls on China, signaling broader tech restrictions ahead of Trump–Xi meeting; Asia markets rose on hopes of dialogue.
Google and Anthropic sign cloud deal worth tens of billions, validating TPU demand and intensifying hyperscaler AI competition and capex.
Intel beats on sales; turnaround stabilizing under government stake. Focus shifts to foundry progress as investors reassess U.S.-backed semiconductor strategy.
Ford beat earnings but cut 2025 guidance; pausing F-150 Lightning expansion and redeploying EV workers highlight cautious pivot amid demand and supply disruptions.
Target to cut 1,800 corporate jobs amid sales slump, its first major layoffs in a decade, signaling continued pressure on big-box retail margins.
Apple begins shipping American-made AI servers from Texas, underscoring U.S. reshoring and surging enterprise demand for on-premise AI infrastructure.
Trump pardons Binance founder Changpeng Zhao, potentially resetting U.S. crypto enforcement posture and unlocking industry expansion domestically.
Existing-home sales rose on lower mortgage rates, but prices remain near records, highlighting affordability constraints despite easing rate pressure.
U.S. explores UN mandate for Gaza security force while ruling out West Bank annexation, signaling a calibrated Middle East posture with coalition-building focus.
Experimental therapy cut LDL cholesterol nearly 50% without statins or notable side effects, pointing to a potential paradigm shift in cardiovascular disease management.
